subject: Business
title: Blitzscaling: Speed vs. Efficiency
description: A quick win: understand Blitzscaling: Speed vs. Efficiency.

hook.text: Reid Hoffman says blitzscaling means choosing speed over efficiency in the face of uncertainty.

buildup.text: In winner-take-all markets, the first to dominate wins. Efficiency can come later.

discovery.text: Uber burned billions to establish city-by-city dominance before competitors could catch up.

twist.text: Blitzscaling only works in winner-take-all markets. In most industries, burning cash just burns cash.

climax.text: WeWork tried to blitzscale office space â€” a commodity market. The strategy backfired.

punchline.text: Speed wins when the prize is monopoly. Otherwise it's waste.

quiz.question: When does blitzscaling make sense?
options: In winner-take-all markets where speed determines the winner
In any market where growth is possible
When a company has unlimited funding
